alert.note: Alert for DeKalb (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 29 at 11:06PM CDT by NWS Huntsville
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 AM CDT SATURDAY... ...REPLACES FLASH FLOOD WARNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Alabama, including the following county, DeKalb. * WHEN...Until 200 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1105 PM CDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Flooding is ongoing in southern DeKalb County. Between 2 and 5 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Crossville, Geraldine, Skirum, Lathamville, Rodentown, Kilpatrick, Painter, Arona and Lebanon. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
